meanings.definition: A large, heavy hammer used for breaking rocks or driving in stakes.
meanings.sent1: The construction worker used a sledgehammer to break the big rocks.
meanings.sent2: He found the sledgehammer in the shed and used it to drive in the stakes for the tent.
meanings.sent3: The sledgehammer thought it was a rock star as it smashed through the boulders.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was a sledgehammer, breaking down any obstacle in her path.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the sledgehammer hitting the rocks echoed through the valley.

meanings.definition: To strike forcefully with a sledgehammer.
meanings.sent1: He had to sledgehammer the nail into the wall to hang the picture.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith sledgehammered the hot metal to shape it into a horseshoe.
meanings.sent3: The chef sledgehammered the garlic to release its flavor into the dish.
meanings.sent4: Her words sledgehammered his heart, leaving him feeling broken.
meanings.sent5: The boxer sledgehammered his opponent with a powerful blow to the jaw.
